meanings.definition: A person who saws wood as a profession.
meanings.sent1: The sawyers worked hard cutting the logs.
meanings.sent2: We hired sawyers to help with the construction project.
meanings.sent3: The sawyers joked about having 'sawdust in their veins'.
meanings.sent4: The sawyers' precision with the saw was like a dance.
meanings.sent5: The sound of sawyers at work echoed through the forest.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'sawyer', referring to more than one person who saws wood.
meanings.sent1: Many sawyers gathered to compete in the woodcutting contest.
meanings.sent2: The sawyers in the workshop shared tips and tricks.
meanings.sent3: The sawyers' tools clinked together as they worked in unison.
meanings.sent4: The sawyers' teamwork was as smooth as a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The group of sawyers displayed impressive skill and coordination.

meanings.definition: The possessive form of the word 'sawyer', indicating ownership or association with a person who saws wood.
meanings.sent1: The sawyers' workshop was filled with the scent of fresh wood.
meanings.sent2: I borrowed a sawyers' tool for my own project.
meanings.sent3: The sawyers' camaraderie was evident in their shared laughter.
meanings.sent4: The sawyers' dedication to their craft was unmatched.
meanings.sent5: The sawyers' expertise was recognized throughout the town.
